title: Zosteriform palisaded encapsulated neuroma: an unusual presentation.
label: Figure 1
caption: Multiple, discrete, flesh colored, soft to firm, papules and nodules arranged in a curvilinear fashion on the face

title: Zosteriform palisaded encapsulated neuroma: an unusual presentation.
label: Figure 2
caption: Multiple partially encapsulated, well-circumscribed nodules in the dermis (H and E, ×40)

title: Zosteriform palisaded encapsulated neuroma: an unusual presentation.
label: Figure 3
caption: Fascicles of small spindle cells with wavy nuclei interlaced with small slits and clefts (H and E, ×100)

title: Zosteriform palisaded encapsulated neuroma: an unusual presentation.
label: Figure 4
caption: Tumor mass showing positive S-100 (immunohistochemical staining, ×100)

title: Palisaded Encapsulated Neuroma of the Tongue Clinically Mimicking a Pyogenic Granuloma: A Case Report and Review of Literature.
label: Fig. 1.
caption: Clinical view of a PEN on the dorsum of the tongue.

title: Palisaded Encapsulated Neuroma of the Tongue Clinically Mimicking a Pyogenic Granuloma: A Case Report and Review of Literature.
label: Fig. 2.
caption: Positive immunoreactivity of tumoral cells with S100 antibody (×400).

title: Palisaded Encapsulated Neuroma of the Tongue Clinically Mimicking a Pyogenic Granuloma: A Case Report and Review of Literature.
label: Fig. 3.
caption: Photomicrograph showing an encapsulated proliferation of neoplastic cells (hematoxylin and eosin staining; original magnification ×40).

title: Palisaded Encapsulated Neuroma of the Tongue Clinically Mimicking a Pyogenic Granuloma: A Case Report and Review of Literature.
label: Fig. 4.
caption: The tumor composed of spindle cells in distinct fascicular pattern. No evidence of malignancy is observed (hematoxylin and eosin staining; original magnification ×400).

title: Palisaded Encapsulated Neuroma in a Zosteriform Distribution.
label: Figure 1
caption: There are multiple, zosteriform, discrete, flesh colored, soft to firm, papules and nodules on the neck

title: Palisaded Encapsulated Neuroma in a Zosteriform Distribution.
label: Figure 2
caption: Skin biopsy specimen revealed a normal epidermis. In the dermis, there was a partially encapsulated, well-circumscribed nodules composed of fascicles of small spindle cells with wavy nuclei interlaced with small slits and clefts which are positive for S100 protein. There was no nuclear pleiomorphism or mitoses. (H and E, ×500 μm (a), x1000 ìm (b), x100 ìm (c), S100 protein (d))

title: Palisaded Encapsulated Neuroma of the Trunk: A Case Report and Review of Palisaded Encapsulated Neuroma.
label: Figure 1
caption: A distant view of a palisaded encapsulated neuroma on the left flank of a 65-year-old Caucasian male

title: Palisaded Encapsulated Neuroma of the Trunk: A Case Report and Review of Palisaded Encapsulated Neuroma.
label: Figure 2
caption: A high magnification view of the microscopic changes noted on a palisaded encapsulated neuroma from a tissue biopsy of a 65-year-old male's left flank tumorFascicles of benign-appearing spindle cells with palisading of their nuclei are observed in the upper dermis. There are also clefts between the neural cells and the surrounding stroma. (Hematoxylin and eosin; x20)

title: Palisaded Encapsulated (Solitary Circumscribed) Neuroma of the Buccal Mucosa: a Rare Case.
label: Figure1
caption: A pedunculated submucosal mass with a cylindrical shape in the left posterior buccal mucosa

title: Palisaded Encapsulated (Solitary Circumscribed) Neuroma of the Buccal Mucosa: a Rare Case.
label: Figure2
caption: Microscopic examination of the lesion showed a well-circumscribed mass. The overlying epithelium was intact and chronic inflammatory cells were scattered.

title: Palisaded Encapsulated (Solitary Circumscribed) Neuroma of the Buccal Mucosa: a Rare Case.
label: Figure3
caption: Fascicular proliferation of spindle cells showed tendency toward nuclear palisading. Apparent verocay bodies were not observed.

title: Palisaded Encapsulated (Solitary Circumscribed) Neuroma of the Buccal Mucosa: a Rare Case.
label: Figure4
caption: The lesion cells were strongly positive for S-100 protein.

title: Palisaded Encapsulated Neuroma: An Unusual Presentation.
label: Figure 1
caption: Multiple skin-colored discrete and coalescing papules and nodules on face extending from tip of ear to the angle of the mandible involving maxillary and mandibular divisions of the trigeminal nerve

title: Palisaded Encapsulated Neuroma: An Unusual Presentation.
label: Figure 2
caption: Similar skin-colored papules and nodules present over the back in a segmental pattern involving the T-7 dermatome

title: Palisaded Encapsulated Neuroma: An Unusual Presentation.
label: Figure 3
caption: Partially encapsulated intradermal nodule composed of interdigitating spindle cells grouped in distinct fascicles (H and E, ×100)

title: Palisaded Encapsulated Neuroma: An Unusual Presentation.
label: Figure 4
caption: Spindle cells arranged in distinct fascicles. Individual cells are poorly delineated with eosinophilic cytoplasm, and pointed, wavy basophilic nuclei. There is lack of nuclear pleomorphism and mitoses (H and E, ×400)

title: Palisaded encapsulated neuroma of the upper labial mucosa: Case report.
label: Figure 1
caption: Histopathological and immunostained microphotographs of our case of palisaded encapsulated neuroma. (A) Low-power microphotograph exhibiting that the tumor was well-defined, moderately to highly cellular, located at the subepithelial area, and covered by parakeratinized stratified squamous epithelium (Hematoxylin and eosin stain or H&E; original magnification, 4 ×). (B, C and D) Medium- and high-power microphotographs demonstrating that the tumor was composed of a sheet of spindle cells with wavy and pointed nuclei but without significant pleomorphism or mitotic activity (H&E; original magnification; B, 20 × ; C, 40 × ; D, 40 ×). (E and F) Immunostained microphotograph showing that the spindle-shaped tumor cells were diffusely positive for S-100 protein and a few small axons (pointed by black arrows) were found within the tumor (Immunostain; original magnification, E, 40 × , F, 20 ×).

title: Palisaded encapsulated neuroma on the lower lip: a case report.
label: Fig. 1.
caption: Clinical photograph revealing a 0.4×0.4 cm solitary pinkish nodule on the lower lip.

title: Palisaded encapsulated neuroma on the lower lip: a case report.
label: Fig. 2.
caption: (A) Histopathologic examination of the lower lip tissue shows a well-circumscribed nodule encapsulated by connective tissue stroma in the dermis (hematoxylin and eosin [H&E] stain, ×12.5). (B) The nodule consists of palisading spindle-shaped tumor cells with wavy, basophilic nuclei arranged as streaming fascicles and separated by clefts (H&E stain, ×100). (C, D) The tumor cells are strongly positive for S-100 proteins (immunohistochemical stain, [C] ×12.5, [D] ×100). (E) Neurofilament protein staining is focally positive within spindle cell fascicles, indicating the presence of axons (immunohistochemical stain, ×100).

title: Dermoscopic Clues in Diagnosis of Zosteriform Palisaded Encapsulated Neuroma.
label: Figure 1
caption: Multiple skin-coloured to erythematous nodules of various sizes over the left side of front of the chest

title: Dermoscopic Clues in Diagnosis of Zosteriform Palisaded Encapsulated Neuroma.
label: Figure 2
caption: (a) Dermoscopy showing reddish white area with overlying loss of hair (Dermlite DL3N, 10X, contact, non-polarised mode) (b) On dermoscopy, out of focus arborizing vessels (black arrows) on a pinkish-red background (with yellow star), whitish areas (green arrows) and mild peripheral pigmentation/dark yellowish halo was noticed. (Dermlite DL3N 10X, non-contact, polarised mode)

title: Dermoscopic Clues in Diagnosis of Zosteriform Palisaded Encapsulated Neuroma.
label: Figure 3
caption: (a) Normal epidermis, well circumscribed, partially encapsulated nodule showing multinodularity in the papillary dermis. Hair follicles are absent. (H and E staining 40X) (b) showing broad fascicles of uniform Schwann cells with wavy nuclei (yellow arrows) with small slits and clefts (black arrow) (H and E 200X)

title: Oral palisaded encapsulated neuroma; a diagnosis seldom suspected clinically.
